title: Webhook Router & Edge Ingress Service
description: Lightweight webhook ingress and routing service with token-based authentication, file-backed secret management, rate limiting, and containerized deployment. Designed for reliability, easy key rotation, and internal service isolation.
highlights: Edge ingress service authenticates requests via per-client tokens
Secrets loaded from a file-backed key store (bind-mounted into container)
Key ownership mapping enables fast revoke/rotate without code changes
Strict request size limits and per-IP rate limiting
Clear separation between edge ingress and internal router service
Dockerized services with profile-based startup for local vs production use
impact: Enabled secure, centralized ingestion of internal webhooks across multiple self-hosted services, with fast key rotation and zero-downtime config changes.

title: Shared Photo Frame Platform
description: A self-hosted, end-to-end photo frame ecosystem designed for non-technical users to safely upload photos while maintaining a resilient, offline-first display client. Built to run unattended on low-power hardware, with cloud-backed manifests, strict access control, and automated synchronization.
highlights: Offline-first frame client (Raspberry Pi & Android tablet support) that continues operating without network access
Cloud-backed manifest-driven architecture decoupling content selection from display logic
Automated publisher pipeline generating deterministic manifests from S3 object state
Secure, minimal-permission upload workflows using presigned URLs and scoped IAM policies
Multiple ingestion paths: web upload UI, HTTP drop endpoints, Samba/photo-drop workflows
Systemd-managed services for frame runtime, sync jobs, and watchdog reliability
Clear separation of concerns: publisher, viewer, sync tooling, and client UI
Designed explicitly for long-term unattended operation in real-world home deployments
impact: Deployed in a real family environment with non-technical users; operates unattended for weeks at a time without intervention.

Heartbeat feed renders last 7 events (ntfy)
Git-based deploy to home server

title: Heartbeat Checks via NTFY (cron + shell)
description: Tiny healthcheck/heartbeat mesh: cron + shell client posts uptime and service status to ntfy; optional FastAPI relay.
highlights: /usr/local/bin/heartbeat.sh with host tech
Topic naming convention + retention docs
Container-safe: curl-only option; no agents
impact: Early warnings for service failures; <1 min mean detection time across VMs/LXCs.

title: iOS Shortcut Automation Suite (Privacy-First Capture + Self-Hosted AI Integrations)
description: A suite of Apple Shortcuts that standardizes quick capture (clipboard/share sheet/voice), enforces clean data handoffs, and produces consistent structured outputs for work and personal workflows. Core flows use Apple Shortcuts’ on-device model; advanced flows optionally call self-hosted LLM endpoints (Ollama/Open WebUI) over Tailscale.
highlights: Brain Dump: clipboard-first (or prompt if empty) + on-device model to turn messy thoughts into priorities, next actions, questions, and a short plan in the user’s tone
Reusable 'safe dictionary' pattern to prevent broken handoffs between shortcuts and preserve required fields/defaults
Share-sheet entry points for quick capture from apps; consistent formatting for highlights/Reminders/logs
Optional AI integrations: Shortcuts that POST to Ollama/Open WebUI endpoints via webhook/router over Tailscale (no third-party SaaS required)
Built with edge cases in mind: empty inputs, missing fields, retries/timeouts for network calls, and deterministic templates for repeatable outputs
impact: Reduced time spent on repetitive admin and note-processing by turning unstructured inputs into predictable, reusable formats; privacy-first defaults keep sensitive content on-device with opt-in, controlled self-hosted processing for richer outputs.

title: Wiki.js MCP Server for Open WebUI
description: Custom MCP server (Python) to create/search Wiki.js pages directly from Open WebUI, enabling hands-on docs automation.
highlights: mcpo wrapper; structured commands (create/find/update)
Auth + namespace routing
Unit tests for page ops; error surface to UI
Docs: setup + sample flows
impact: One-click page creation from the chat UI; reduced context switching and stale docs.

title: Heart Log – AI-Powered Love Language Classifier
description: Flask-based web app with integrated API that classifies user-submitted relationship moments into love language categories using a local Ollama LLM.
highlights: Two Flask endpoints: main UI + categorization API
Prompt-engineered JSON output for consistent structure
Handles malformed responses gracefully with fallback parsing
Decoupled Ollama server over LAN for flexible deployment
Dockerized for portability; environment-driven configuration
impact: Automates categorization of personal relationship entries, enabling quick reflection on patterns over time without manual tagging.

title: Capybara Party
description: A whimsical Flask web app serving daily capybara-themed art and zen-like quotes generated with local AI models. Built to be playful, self-sustaining, and low-maintenance while showcasing Python backend and automation skills.
highlights: Flask backend serving daily refreshed static content (images + quotes)
AI integration: Ollama models generate inspirational quotes, Stable Diffusion generates artwork
Automated daily update pipeline with cron and file rotation
Systemd service for process management and reliability
Nginx reverse proxy for clean domain routing with SSL
Lightweight, self-contained design — minimal upkeep once deployed

title: Sunflower Log
description: A photo-journal web app to track and share the growth of a sunflower over the summer. Combines a clean Flask interface with structured logging, EXIF photo metadata extraction, and production-grade deployment behind Nginx.
highlights: Flask backend with file upload, EXIF metadata parsing, and thumbnail generation
Responsive UI with gallery-style layout for browsing photo entries
Confirmation modal on upload to prevent accidental duplicates
Deployed behind Nginx reverse proxy with custom domain and SSL
Gunicorn WSGI server managed via systemd for reliability
Organized project structure with Docker-ready configuration for future portability
CI/CD hooks for smooth updates via Git
